p: Dried leaves and bracts of O. vulgare were procured and essential oil [ Figure 3] was extracted using hydrodistillation method. The dry leaves were used in a Clevenger apparatus for 4 h to extract the oils with CHCl 3, and then, it was dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate. The oil yield was stored in sealed amber-colored vial at 4Â°C until use.
